page.title: Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda link allegations timeline

rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.

{{multiple issues|disputed=August 2008|POV=August 2008|cleanup =November 2006}}

â
[[Image:Saddam Hussein on his throne.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Saddam Hussein with the [[Flag of Iraq#1991â2004|flag of Iraq]] he implemented during the [[Gulf War]]]]
 
The '''Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda timeline''' below list allegations of meetings, all but one now discounted, denied or disproven by the United States Government, between [[al-Qaeda]] members and members of [[Saddam Hussein]]'s government, as well as other information relevant to [[conspiracy theories]] involving [[Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda]]. Not all of the specific claims about meetings can be substantiated with evidence, and that many of the intelligence agencies and experts who have analyzed the evidence have concluded that no substantial links exist. As terrorism analyst Evan Kohlman points out, "While there have been a number of promising intelligence leads hinting at possible meetings between al-Qaeda members and elements of the former [[Baghdad]] regime, nothing has been yet shown demonstrating that these potential contacts were historically any more significant than the same level of communication maintained between [[Osama bin Laden]] and ruling elements in a number of Iraq's [[Persian Gulf]] neighbors, including [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Iran]], [[Yemen]], [[Qatar]], and [[Kuwait]]."<ref name="commondreams20030803">{{cite web| last = Canellos| first = Peter S.| coauthors = and Bryan Bender| title = Questions Grow Over Iraq Links to Qaeda| publisher = CommonDreams.org| date = 3 August 2003| url = http://www.commondreams.org/headlines03/0803-04.htm| accessdate = 6 December 2006 }}</ref>
The '''Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda timeline''' below list allegations of meetings, all but one now discounted, denied or disproven by the United States Government, between [[al-Qaeda]] members and members of [[Saddam Hussein]]'s government, as well as other information relevant to [[conspiracy theories]] involving [[Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda]]. Not all of the specific claims about meetings can be substantiated with evidence, and that many of the intelligence agencies and experts who have analyzed the evidence have concluded that no substantial links exist. As terrorism analyst Evan Kohlman points out, "While there have been a number of promising intelligence leads hinting at possible meetings between al-Qaeda members and elements of the former [[Baghdad]] regime, nothing has been yet shown demonstrating that these potential contacts were historically any more significant than the same level of communication maintained between [[Osama bin Laden]] and ruling elements in a number of Iraq's [[Persian Gulf]] neighbors, including [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Iran]], [[Yemen]], [[Qatar]], and [[Kuwait]]."<ref name="commondreams20030803">{{cite web| last = Canellos| first = Peter S.| coauthors = and Bryan Bender| title = Questions Grow Over Iraq Links to Qaeda| publisher = CommonDreams.org| date = 3 August 2003| url = http://www.commondreams.org/headlines03/0803-04.htm| accessdate = 6 December 2006 }}</ref>
